page.description: The CheckBox control can be used to add checkboxes to an application. Multiple checkboxes can be specified as a single CheckBox control.

discussion.p: The CheckBox control can be displayed as a single logical check box or a list of choices that is statically or dynamically populated. Configuring a CheckBox control is similar to configuring a RadioButton. The main difference between the two control types is that a RadioButton can only have one value while a CheckBox control can have multiple values.

See also the *[link:RadioButton Control@ux data controls radio button control]* for additional articles about *[link:custom styling@Custom Styling for Radio Buttons]*, *[link:rendering as a button list@ux data controls radio button control render radio buttons as a button list]*, and *[link:dynamically repopulating values@ux data controls radio button control dynamically repopulate choices in a radiobutton control]*.
